result.execSummary:
The defendant Sidney S. Daniels Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any sentence that the defendant is currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes: To be paid with any prison wages or funds that the defendant may be entitled to and the remainder to be paid within the first year of ES.

The defendant must obtain his GED.

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns.
The defendant must submit a DNA sample.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: To count #1 but consecutive to any sentence that the defendant is currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes: To be paid with any prison wages or funds that the defendant may be entitled to and the remainder to be paid within the first year of ES.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Sidney S. Daniels in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defendant Sidney S. Daniels in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:17 AM. Also called 15CF152, 15CF48 anbd 15CF160. State - has tendeered a plea in 15CF160 and 15CF152 and to compelte same process in other two cases - were waiting for paperwork to be completed by both parties and if it is - we can proceed today with sentencing. Joy states that Judge Kussel has signed the appropriate paperwork. Court checks those two files and does see the proper paperwork that is needed to proceed today. State - defendant entered a plea to count #1 on 15CF152 and to counts #1, #3 and #6 on 15CF160, no pleas have yet been entered on 15CF20 and 15CF48; State instructs Court that the defendant would plead to counts #1 and #4 as alleged on 15CF20 and DRI remaining counts, 15CF478 - plead G to counts #2 and #3 with count #1 being DRI. Joy and Daniels agree. State - joint recommendation of 10 years in prison consisting of 5 in and 5 out, not joint is if the time should run concurrent or consecutive to time he is currently serving, Joy and Daniels agree. Daniels pleads G to counts #2 and #3 on 15CF48 and Court dismisses and reads in count #1. Daniels plead G to counts #1 and #4 on 15CF20 and Court dismisses and reads in counts #2, #3 and #5 on same case. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - has complied with victim notification requirements - follow joint recommendation - requsting time to run consecutive to any time that the defendant is currently serving for stated reasons. Joy makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - requesting time to run concurrent to any time that the defendant is currently serving for stated reasons - discussion on credit - suggests conservatorship for defendant's finances. Daniels makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: will be running the sentences consecutive to each other; 15CF20 - #1 - 10 years in WI State Prison System consisting of 5 in and 5 out - conseuctive to sentence he is currently serving, #4 - 10 years in Prison with 5 in and 5 out - concurrent to count #1; 15CF152 - count #1 - 9 months in jail - concurrent with count #1 on 15CF20 but consecutive to current prison term; 15CF48 - #2 - 9 months in jail - concurrent to count #1 on 15CF20 and consecutive to current prison term; #3 - 6 years in WI State Prison consisting of 3 in and 3 out - consecutive to current prison time; 15CF16 - #1 - 3.5 years of WI prison with 1.5 years in and 2 out - consecutive to current prison term; #3 - 3.5 years in prison, consisting of 1.5 in and 2 out - concurrent to count #1 but consecutive to current prison term; #6 - 6 years in WI State Prison - consisting of 3 years in and 3 out - concurrent to count #1 but consecutive to current prison term, $1000.00 fine plus costs and assessment on all counts - take bond posted - take any money due thru prison wages - remainder due within first year on ES, obtain GED, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, obtain/maintain full time employment/school, submit DNA sample, eligible for earned release and substance abuse, right to appeal, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, no credit available, adjourned.
assigning to Judge Stenz from Judge Kussel
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 2, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Sidney S. Daniels in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defendant Sidney S. Daniels in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:56 PM. Also called 15CF152, 15CF160 and 15CF48. State - defendant is attempting to accomplish a transfer of cases back to Judge Stenz for all to be plead out in front of Judge Stenz. Joy responds and updates Court on cases, order to transfer, etc. Court would like to proceed on 15CF152 and 15CF160. Joy states that there is a global agreement on all four cases. Court responds. Discussion on issue. Court adjourns all matters until paperwork is completed to complete the transfer back to FC, continues bond. Attorney Joy to get a date from JA's when the paperwork is completed. Court sets for PLEAS.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Sidney S. Daniels in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 12:00 PM. 15CF48 & 15CF20. Joy here for change of plea, files were in front of Judge Kussel, due to a filing of substituition of Judge from prior counsel and Judge Kussel has no objection to transfer these cases back to Judge Stenz. Court - responds he cannot hear cases that he has been substituted on and advises parties on process of getting them transferred back to his calendar. State questions if Kussel can take the plea and then Stenz to sentence. Kussel to here plea and Joy to prepare paperwork for transfer.

Defendant Sidney S. Daniels in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defendant Sidney S. Daniels in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:53 AM. State - here for a plea, defendant is on loan from a correctional facility, believe that the defense will be asking Judge Stenz to sentence the defendant on these two cases by reverting the substititon back to Stenz but take a plea on these two matters in front of Kussel today. Joy agrees, wants to un-substitute or un-ring the bell. Court informs parties that he has contacted the DCA on this matter and there are two different ways to handle it and stated those two choices. Counsel all agrees. Court does re-vert matters back to Judge Stenz, continues bond.
from Attorney Joy requesting adjournment of JT

Attorney Thomas Clinton Roley in court. No other appearances. Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:05 PM. Roley has filed motion to withdraw as counsel. Roley indicates defendant has requested him to withdraw. Court will allow counsel to withdraw as counsel. Roley makes statement.

Defendant Sidney S. Daniels in court with attorney Thomas Clinton Roley.  Defendant Sidney S. Daniels in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:45 PM. Also called 15CF48. State - defendant is in custody on other related charges - were originally scheduled to JT today and then PLEAS per defendant and understands that he now wants a JT again. Roley responds. Court gives defendant his warning on changing mind with having JT at late date, matter was scheduled for JT today. Court continues bond, sets for JT, no PTC needed. Defense or State have no special MIL, regular MIL will be heard morning of trial, Court will prepare standard instructions. State - makes verbal motion to have bond reviewed in both cases for stated reasons - $10,000.00 cash on each of these matters. Roley - bond - asks bond to continue for stated reasons. Court - bond - increases each bond by $5000.00 cash with same conditions on each case.  Jury trial scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sidney S. Daniels in court with attorney Thomas Clinton Roley.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 12:32 PM. Also called 15CF48. Roley - cases are not resolved - set both for JT. Court continues bond, set both for JT on 9/22/15 (15CF20 is already set for JT on that day).  Jury trial scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Final pre-trial at 07-21-2015 11:45 am.
Jury trial at 09-22-2015 08:30 am.

Defendant Sidney S. Daniels in court with attorney Thomas Clinton Roley.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:29 AM. Also called 15CF48. State - here for FPT on 15CF20 and PH on 15CF48. Roley - willing to proceed on PH. State - asks court to take judicial notice that the defendant was out on bond on 14CF20 when 14CF58 occurred. Roley has no objections. Court takes judicial notice of that. State calls Deputy Jason Novak. Novak sworn in. Direct exam by State at 9:31 AM. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant. Cross exam by Roley at 9:39 AM. State objects - relevance - Roley explains relevance - sustains (9:41 AM). Novak excused at 9:42 AM. State - believes it mets its proof for today's hearing and if Court agrees and asks for finding of probable cause and bind over - State has served TT who did not appear and if Court believes it is necessary - asks for material witness warrant. Roley responds - willing to concede probable cause for stated reasons. Court will find probable cause, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors the complaint. Roley has Information, waives reading of it, asks for a date for ARGN. State responds - would prefer to proceed to ARGN sometime this AM allowing Roley time to discuss the matter with the defendant. Roley will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond on 15CF48 on 7/21/15 at 11:45 AM. In regards to 15CF20 - what is progress. Roley asks for that matter to be set for another FPT on 7/21/15. State prefers that this matter be set for JT instead. Court continues bond on this case as well.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 11:45 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sidney S. Daniels in court with attorney Thomas Clinton Roley.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:21 AM. Also called 15CF48. Roley - 15CF20 - has Information, waives reading of it, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas on this matter, continues bond, set for FPT. 15CF48 - needs to be set for PH, time limits have been waived, continues bond.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Arraignment cancelled due to the request for substitution of judge.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant Sidney S. Daniels in court with attorney Thomas Clinton Roley.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:47 PM. Roley will proceed with PH. State calls Deputy Steve Ashbeck. Ashbeck sworn in at 3:47 PM. Direct exam by State. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant. Cross exam by Roley at 4:00 PM. Re-direct by State at 4:03 PM. Ashbeck excused at 4:03 PM. Court finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors complaint. Roley has Information, wants date for ARGN. Court continues bond, set for ARGN.  Arraignment scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 03:45 pm.

Sidney Daniels appears via video from FC jail. Attorney Tom Roley appears in person on behalf of Sidney Daniels. Charles Simono appears for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:10 p.m. Roley now has complaint, but has not went over complaint with client, but Daniels has seen the warrant with complaint. Roley waives further reading. Roley - $1000 cash bond with $2500 signature bond and remain at home until PH. Simono - $2000 cash bond. Court questions defendant on employment. Court imposes $1000 cash bond. No consumption of alcohol. Roley waives time limits for PH.
